isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - MAIN DRIVE GEAR ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If previously removed, install the snap ring in the I.D. of the main drive gear ( Figure 389) and the bushing in the pocket of the input shaft ( inset, Figure 389).

figure.caption: Figure 388. Install Snap Ring in I.D. of Main Drive Gear and Bushing in Pocket of Input Shaft

step1.para: Mark the main drive gear for timing purposes. Mark any two adjacent teeth on the drive gear and repeat the procedure for the two adjacent teeth directly opposite the first set marked ( Figure 390). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.

figure.caption: Figure 389. Mark Main Drive Gear For Timing Purposes

step1.para: Mesh the marked tooth of the left countershaft drive gear with two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 391). Slide the input shaft through the main drive gear ( inset, Figure 391).

figure.caption: Figure 390. Mesh Marked Tooth of Left Countershaft Drive Gear With Marked Teeth on Main Drive Gear, and Slide Input Shaft Through Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Install the spacer ( inset, Figure 392). Install the bearing on the input shaft with the external snap ring to the outside.

figure.caption: Figure 391. Install Spacer and Install Bearing

step1.para: Tap the bearing into position in the bore with a soft mallet ( Figure 393).
Temporarily install the front bearing cover ( Figure 394).

figure.caption: Figure 393. Temporarily Install Front Bearing Cover

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to drive the input shaft through the bearing ( Figure 395). Remove the front bearing cover.

figure.caption: Figure 394. Drive Input Shaft Through Bearing
